document.docAuthor: Giroti, André Marsola & Brescovit, Antonio Domingos
document.docTitle: Ariadna lalen Giroti & Brescovit 2018, new species
document.masterDocTitle: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type-material. ♂ holotype from Reserva Nacional Los Ruiles , elev.
174m
( 35°50'02,6"S ; 72°30'35,7"W ), Cauquenes , Cauquenes Province , VII Región de Maule , Chile ,
17.VII.2010
, A. Ojanguren et al. leg., deposited in MACN-Ar 29457 .
Paratypes : 1♂ from Contulmo Natural Monument [ 38°01'55"S ; 73°04'22"W ],
Purén, Malleco
, IX Región de Araucanía , Chile ,
11.XII.1984
‒
13.II.1985
, S. & J. Peck leg. ( AMNH )
;
1♀ 2imm. from Estación Biológica de Hualpén ,
10m
, Concepción , VIII Región de Bío-Bío , Chile ( 36°47'51.2"S ; 73°09'29.3"W ),
15‒16.VII.2010
, A
.
Ojanguren et al. leg. (MACN-Ar 29456); 3♀ 2imm. same data of the last (MACN-Ar 2 9454).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 62.
Ariadna lalen
n. sp.
. Male (Paratype) from Contulmo Natural Monument (AMNH) (A‒E): habitus, dorsal (A) and ventral view (B); right leg I, prolateral (C) and retrolateral view (D); right metatarsus I, ventral view (E). Female (Paratype) from Estação Biológica de Hualpén (MACN-Ar 29456) (F‒I): habitus, dorsal (F) and ventral view (G); right leg I, prolateral (H) and retrolateral view (I). Scale bar: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes. One male of this species was illustrated by Grismado (2008: 347, figs 7A‒C) as a male of
A. araucana
. After the examination of this specimen and comparing it with others from the same region of occurence, we assumed that it represents a new species, similar to
A. araucana
in the habitus and leg macrosetae pattern, but with differences in the male and female genitalia. Grismado (2008: 353) stated that the vial labeled as “
longipes ”
from “Pissis”, anteriorly recognized as one of the types of
Dysdera longipes Nicolet, 1849
by Ramírez (1989) (MNHNP- AR 9069, anteriorly 4211), possess a female specimen that differs from the ones of the vial from Valdivia, with one male and two females ( MNHNP-AR 9067, anteriorly 4133). Because of that, Grismado (2008: 353) designated the specimen from “Pissis” as a non-type
Ariadna araucana
, one of his new species. Here we identifiy this female specimen as
Ariadna lalen
n. sp.
, due to differences from
A. araucana
in the female genitalia.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 63.
Ariadna lalen
n. sp.
. Male (Paratype) from Contulmo Natural Monument (AMNH) (A‒B): right palp, prolateral view (A) (arrowhead = chemosensory patch), and retrolateral view (B). Female (Paratype) from Estação Biológica de Hualpén (MACN-Ar 29454) (C‒D): internal genitalia, lateral view (E); anterior receptaculum, ventral view (F). Scale bar: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Ariadna lalen
n. sp.
is similar to
A. araucana
due to the presence of reduced mid-portion in the male palp, and females with leg formula II-I-IV-III and absence of the median membranous crack in the interpulmonary fold; males of
Ariadna lalen
n. sp.
differ from those of
A. araucana
by the presence of a subrectangular bulb, less rounded than
A. araucana
, with mid-portion and embolus markedly bended and thickened ( Fig. 63A‒B ); females of
A. lalen
n. sp.
differ from
A. araucana
by the anterior receptaculum, flattened laterally, with the dorsal region incrassated and rounded ( Fig. 63C‒D ).

Etymology. The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the “Mapundungun”, the language spoken by the Mapuche people that live in Araucanía , and other regions of southern Chile and Argentina . It refers to the old legend of the Lalén Kuzé, la “Araña Vieja” (“ancient spider”), a mythological creature that appears to the Mapuche women in their dreams to teach the art of weaving.
Variation. Male (n=2): Total length 8.0‒8.56; carapace 3.72‒4.4 long, 2.64‒3.2 wide; femur I 3.52‒4.48. Female (n=6): Total length 10.72‒15.6; carapace 4.84‒5.92 long, 3.04‒3.6; femur I 3.16‒3.88.
